items: Start by lying on your back with your knees bent and your feet flat on the ground.
Hold a kettlebell in your right hand and extend your right arm straight up towards the ceiling.
Extend your left leg straight out and hover it just above the ground.
Engage your core and slowly lower your right arm and left leg towards the ground, keeping them hovering just above the floor.
Pause for a moment and then return to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side, holding the kettlebell in your left hand and extending your left arm and right leg.
Continue alternating sides for the desired number of repetitions.
Strengthens the core muscles, including the abs, obliques, and lower back
Improves stability and balance
Increases overall body strength and power
Helps to prevent lower back pain and injury
Can be modified for different fitness levels and abilities
Engages multiple muscle groups at once for a more efficient workout
Can be done with minimal equipment and space
